title: How to find my 'rap voice' - Quora

response.answer_text: I guess you would find it in your most confident, braggadocious, ““I don’t give a fudge” combined tone. The tone of voice where you are certain you’re gonna win poker hand, you know you just won an argument with your significant other or when you just dropped the mic on someone during a debate. Get in the state of mind where you are the strongest, smartest, funniest, sexiest mother lover in the house. Then double it and VOILA!

Practice, practice, practice. It’s a process finding a “rap voice” that’s comfortable. I’ve gone through a lot. In the end, find what’s most comfortable, and find what makes you feel confident. Some people force their rap voices, and if you find a “forced” voice comfortable, then go for it (this might be a bit unpopular). Personally, forcing my voice causes me to strain it, and I can’t rap even three verses without feeling sore if I do. Find your own style.
